abstract: New York City files proposed settlement in United States District Court in Manhattan that concedes police activity in public housing developments needs to be improved and more consideration given to resident rights; if approved, settlement will become part of federal monitoring program ordered in 2013 stop-and-frisk case.
lead_paragraph: Plaintiffs charged that residents and visitors in city projects had been stopped or arrested over mundane activities like talking in hallways.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER and J. DAVID GOODMAN

snippet: Plaintiffs charged that residents and visitors in city projects had been stopped or arrested over mundane activities like talking in hallways.

headline.main: New York to Settle Suit on Policing in Public Housing
headline.print_headline: City to Settle Federal Case Over Policing in the Projects
